content: Hey @csmoe -- just saw your PR #64817 -- funny you should open that, as in thinking things through last night I had identified #42340 as one of the first projects we should focus on in/around wg-traits.
I'm also thinking about @blitzerr's branch and shedding a small tear
maybe after you land this PR @csmoe you might want to take a stab at doing the "RFC 2229" refactoring :)

I'm also thinking about blitzerr's branch and shedding a small tear

@nikomatsakis Its unfortunate. I will resume that after the traits and future issues are done
@csmoe left a review here

maybe after you land this PR csmoe you might want to take a stab at doing the "RFC 2229" refactoring :slight_smile:

@nikomatsakis closure/generator were doned. for "refactoring", did you mean rebasing blitzerr's paused branch onto master or else?
@csmoe good question. What I meant by that comment was yes, rebasing (or, more likely, reimplementing) @blitzerr's branch
But I was also thinking that in terms of #42340 it'd be good to start a "design document" with what we think types should look like
I think the structure outlined in the issue is too simplistic
chalk is probably pretty close to the right "overall shape"

csmoe good question. What I meant by that comment was yes, rebasing (or, more likely, reimplementing) blitzerr's branch

okay, any updates on the previous implementation approach? or I will review the doc on dropbox.
ohh, wait, before restarting, I wanna hear from @blitzerr as they said: "...I will resume that after the traits and furture issues..", may I take over this matter from you?

But I was also thinking that in terms of #42340 it'd be good to start a "design document" with what we think types should look like

@nikomatsakis sorry, I'm incapable to provide valuable ideas on such "design document" but eager to volunteer, so need help from your seniors to sketch out that.
